sentences.english: They have to pay hard cash to enter these fortified places.
sentences.chinese: 他們必須支付現金才能進入這些壁壘森嚴的地方。

sentences.english: Is really an infatuated crazy idea, in the whole world the order is severe, again can everyone is emperor.
sentences.chinese: 真是癡心妄想，天地間秩序森嚴，又豈可人人爲皇。

sentences.english: The content introverts' camp closely borders the land of the socially anxious.
sentences.chinese: 內向者的營地將社交焦慮的領地壁壘森嚴地包圍起來。

sentences.english: Lamaism is characterized by elaborate rituals and a strong hierarchical organization.
sentences.chinese: 喇嘛教的主要特點是儀式講究，等級森嚴。

sentences.english: Even the celestial world is heavily guarded.
sentences.chinese: 神仙世界也是戒備森嚴的。

sentences.english: Our line of defense was strongly fortified.
It is very old, and was strongly fortified.
sentences.chinese: 這是非常歲，是壁壘森嚴。

sentences.english: The barriers of the old 19th century class system are in many ways being broken down.
sentences.chinese: 十九世紀等級制度的森嚴壁壘，大都被衝破了。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, there were no signs of tension along the heavily fortified land border separating the two Koreas.
sentences.chinese: 同時，戒備森嚴的兩國陸地邊界附近沒有緊張的跡象。

sentences.english: Disciplined and highly trained, the Vardariotai are elite horse archers.
sentences.chinese: 這些騎兵軍紀森嚴，訓練有素，是精銳的弓騎兵。

sentences.english: These areas become well-guarded bunkers, or silos.
sentences.chinese: 這些勢力範圍成爲戒備森嚴的碉堡或者筒倉。

sentences.english: Is actually an infatuated crazy idea, in the whole world the order is severe, again can everybody is emperor.
sentences.chinese: 真是癡心妄想，天地間秩序森嚴，又豈可人人爲皇。

sentences.english: Security was tight; whole streets were closed off in central Washington.
sentences.chinese: 戒備是森嚴的，在華盛頓中心的整條大街都被封閉。

sentences.english: There once was a monastery that was very strict.
Diaoyutai state guesthouse heavily, make many people feel guards mystery?
sentences.chinese: 釣魚臺國賓館森嚴的警衛，令幾人倍感神祕？

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
nickname of Han dynasty general Li Guang 李廣|李广[Li3 Guang3]
